page.title: 14 SHORNE PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: Shorne school is a small primary school. The good thing about a small school is that you get to know everyone. The present school was built in 1972 and there were about 160 children. There are now only 90 children with 4 class teachers and the headmaster. The school is connected with the church and the vicar takes assembly each Friday. There is an orchard around the school. The school has a Parent teachers association which raises money for the school to buy things. It has bought 3 computers and monitors as well as a video and television. The school attracts children from the nearby towns due to the close knit atmosphere of the small school.
